text: Senate No. : 389         Date: 27.03.2024        Council No. 448               Date: 08.08.2024         Effective Date: 13.03.2023  Degree of the Bachelor of the Science of Engineering Honours

metadata.creator: Microsoft® Word for Microsoft 365
metadata.title: Degree of the Batchelor of the Science of Engineering By-Law No. xx-2013
metadata.author: Office

text:
By-law No. 42 - 2024  
 
University  of Ruhuna  
 
 
By-law made by the Council of the University of Ruhuna on ……………  under Section  135

metadata.creator: Microsoft® Word for Microsoft 365
metadata.title: Degree of the Batchelor of the Science of Engineering By-Law No. xx-2013
metadata.author: Office

text:
of the Universities Act. No. 16 of 1978,  and amendments thereof.  
 
BY- LAW  
 
This By -law may be cited as the Bachelor of the Science of Engineering  Honours  By-law No.

metadata.creator: Microsoft® Word for Microsoft 365
metadata.title: Degree of the Batchelor of the Science of Engineering By-Law No. xx-2013
metadata.author: Office

text:
42-2024  of the University of Ruhuna and shall come into effect on 13.03.2023.    
 
This By -law applies to the Bachelor of the Science of Engineering Honours degree program me,

metadata.creator: Microsoft® Word for Microsoft 365
metadata.title: Degree of the Batchelor of the Science of Engineering By-Law No. xx-2013
metadata.author: Office

text:
offering specializations in Civil and Environmental Engineering, Electrical and Information 
Engineering, Mechanical and Manufacturing Engineering, and Computer Engineering. Any

metadata.creator: Microsoft® Word for Microsoft 365
metadata.title: Degree of the Batchelor of the Science of Engineering By-Law No. xx-2013
metadata.author: Office

text:
differences  among the specialization areas are explicitly mentioned at relevant places.  
 
 
1.0 General Requirements for Award of the Degree

metadata.creator: Microsoft® Word for Microsoft 365
metadata.title: Degree of the Batchelor of the Science of Engineering By-Law No. xx-2013
metadata.author: Office

text:
1.1 The Degree of the Bachelor of the Science of Engineering  Honours  hereinafter referred 
to as "the degree" shall be awarded by the University of  Ruhuna, Sri Lanka, hereinafter

metadata.creator: Microsoft® Word for Microsoft 365
metadata.title: Degree of the Batchelor of the Science of Engineering By-Law No. xx-2013
metadata.author: Office

text:
referred to as "the University" to a student  who:  
a) has been admitted to the University as a student under section l35 of Universities 
Act No. l6 of 1978 and amendments thereof, and

metadata.creator: Microsoft® Word for Microsoft 365
metadata.title: Degree of the Batchelor of the Science of Engineering By-Law No. xx-2013
metadata.author: Office

text:
b) has been duly registered at the University, during the period of study prescribed by 
this By -law, and

metadata.creator: Microsoft® Word for Microsoft 365
metadata.title: Degree of the Batchelor of the Science of Engineering By-Law No. xx-2013
metadata.author: Office

text:
this By -law, and  
c) has completed  the courses of study , to the satisfaction of the Senate, as  prescribed 
by this By -law and Rules and Regulations made thereunder,  and

metadata.creator: Microsoft® Word for Microsoft 365
metadata.title: Degree of the Batchelor of the Science of Engineering By-Law No. xx-2013
metadata.author: Office

text:
d) has passed examinations as prescribed by this By -law and Regulations ma de 
thereunder, and  
e) has paid such fees as prescribed for his/her case by this By -law and the  Regulations

metadata.creator: Microsoft® Word for Microsoft 365
metadata.title: Degree of the Batchelor of the Science of Engineering By-Law No. xx-2013
metadata.author: Office

text:
of the University, and  
f) has fulfilled all the above requirements within eight academic years from the date 
of enrolment for the academic programme of the University, provided that it shall

metadata.creator: Microsoft® Word for Microsoft 365
metadata.title: Degree of the Batchelor of the Science of Engineering By-Law No. xx-2013
metadata.author: Office

text:
be within the power of the Senate to declare for some specified reason(s) that a 
student is  eligible for the award of the Degree on a subsequent occasion, and

metadata.creator: Microsoft® Word for Microsoft 365
metadata.title: Degree of the Batchelor of the Science of Engineering By-Law No. xx-2013
metadata.author: Office

text:
g) has no on -going disciplinary inquiry conducted by the University, and  
h) has no on -going inquiry conducted by the University on examination offences .

metadata.creator: Microsoft® Word for Microsoft 365
metadata.title: Degree of the Batchelor of the Science of Engineering By-Law No. xx-2013
metadata.author: Office

text:
1.2 The Degree shall be conferred on candidates, qualified as in Section 1.1, as prescribed 
by the Regulations made by the Senate.

metadata.creator: Microsoft® Word for Microsoft 365
metadata.title: Degree of the Batchelor of the Science of Engineering By-Law No. xx-2013
metadata.author: Office

text: 1.3 The abbreviation of the name of the Degree shall be BScHons Eng.

metadata.creator: Microsoft® Word for Microsoft 365
metadata.title: Degree of the Batchelor of the Science of Engineering By-Law No. xx-2013
metadata.author: Office

text: Senate No. : 389         Date: 27.03.2024        Council No. 448               Date: 08.08.2024         Effective Date: 13.03.2023  2.0 Programme of Study

metadata.creator: Microsoft® Word for Microsoft 365
metadata.title: Degree of the Batchelor of the Science of Engineering By-Law No. xx-2013
metadata.author: Office

text:
2.1 The programme of study leading to the BScEngHons  degree consists of a common core 
course extending over the first two semesters, and a specialisation course extending

metadata.creator: Microsoft® Word for Microsoft 365
metadata.title: Degree of the Batchelor of the Science of Engineering By-Law No. xx-2013
metadata.author: Office

text:
over the next six semesters.  
 
2.2 In the Common Core Course, a student shall take all Core Modules prescribed by the

metadata.creator: Microsoft® Word for Microsoft 365
metadata.title: Degree of the Batchelor of the Science of Engineering By-Law No. xx-2013
metadata.author: Office

text:
Senate. In the specialisation course, a student, in addition to all Core Modules 
prescribed for the major field of specialisation, shall choose Technical Elective (TE)

metadata.creator: Microsoft® Word for Microsoft 365
metadata.title: Degree of the Batchelor of the Science of Engineering By-Law No. xx-2013
metadata.author: Office

text:
and G eneral Elective (GE) modules as prescribed by the Senate to satisfy the 
requirements.  
 
2.3 The programme of study shall be for a period of not less than four academic years

metadata.creator: Microsoft® Word for Microsoft 365
metadata.title: Degree of the Batchelor of the Science of Engineering By-Law No. xx-2013
metadata.author: Office

text:
including the period of Industrial Training and Development Programme as prescribed  
by the Senate.  
 
2.4 Each academic year will normally consist of two semesters as prescribed in the

metadata.creator: Microsoft® Word for Microsoft 365
metadata.title: Degree of the Batchelor of the Science of Engineering By-Law No. xx-2013
metadata.author: Office

text:
Regulations  under this by -law. 
 
2.5 A student  shall complete a specified period of Industrial Training, at such Institutions/

metadata.creator: Microsoft® Word for Microsoft 365
metadata.title: Degree of the Batchelor of the Science of Engineering By-Law No. xx-2013
metadata.author: Office

text:
Organizations as may be specified by the Coordinator, Engineering Education Centre 
of the Faculty of Engineering.

metadata.creator: Microsoft® Word for Microsoft 365
metadata.title: Degree of the Batchelor of the Science of Engineering By-Law No. xx-2013
metadata.author: Office

text:
2.6 The fields of specialisation and the relevant course modules shall be as laid down by 
the Senate.  
 
2.7 The syllabus for each course module, mode of evaluation, examination criteria, and

metadata.creator: Microsoft® Word for Microsoft 365
metadata.title: Degree of the Batchelor of the Science of Engineering By-Law No. xx-2013
metadata.author: Office

text:
scheme of award of classes  shall  be prescribed by the Senate on the recommendations 
of the Faculty Board.

metadata.creator: Microsoft® Word for Microsoft 365
metadata.title: Degree of the Batchelor of the Science of Engineering By-Law No. xx-2013
metadata.author: Office

text:
of the Faculty Board.  
 
2.8 The credit distribution for Core modules, Technical Elective (TE) modules, General 
Elective (GE) modules and Industrial training for each degree program is indicated

metadata.creator: Microsoft® Word for Microsoft 365
metadata.title: Degree of the Batchelor of the Science of Engineering By-Law No. xx-2013
metadata.author: Office

text:
below.  
 
Module type  Minimum Credit Requirement  
Civil and 
Environmental 
Engineering  Electrical and 
Information 
Engineering  Mechanical 
and 
Manufacturing 
Engineering  Computer

metadata.creator: Microsoft® Word for Microsoft 365
metadata.title: Degree of the Batchelor of the Science of Engineering By-Law No. xx-2013
metadata.author: Office

text:
Engineering  Computer 
Engineering  
Core Modules  130 116 127 115 
Technical/General 
Elective Modules  14 28 17 29 
Industrial Training  6 6 6 6

metadata.creator: Microsoft® Word for Microsoft 365
metadata.title: Degree of the Batchelor of the Science of Engineering By-Law No. xx-2013
metadata.author: Office

text:
3.0 Registration  for the Degree Programme / Course Modules  
 
3.1 A student  selected for admission to the degree programme in the Faculty of 
Engineering,

metadata.creator: Microsoft® Word for Microsoft 365
metadata.title: Degree of the Batchelor of the Science of Engineering By-Law No. xx-2013
metadata.author: Office

text: Senate No. : 389         Date: 27.03.2024        Council No. 448               Date: 08.08.2024         Effective Date: 13.03.2023  a) must satisfy the general University admission requirements for

metadata.creator: Microsoft® Word for Microsoft 365
metadata.title: Degree of the Batchelor of the Science of Engineering By-Law No. xx-2013
metadata.author: Office

text: admission requirements for Faculties of

metadata.creator: Microsoft® Word for Microsoft 365
metadata.title: Degree of the Batchelor of the Science of Engineering By-Law No. xx-2013
metadata.author: Office

text:
Engineering as laid down by the University Grants Commission, Sri Lanka, and  
b) must have been selected according to the stipulated University Admission Criteria.

metadata.creator: Microsoft® Word for Microsoft 365
metadata.title: Degree of the Batchelor of the Science of Engineering By-Law No. xx-2013
metadata.author: Office

text:
3.2 Applicants with foreign qualifications referred for admission by the  University Grants 
Commission shall be admitted only with the consent of the  Faculty Board.

metadata.creator: Microsoft® Word for Microsoft 365
metadata.title: Degree of the Batchelor of the Science of Engineering By-Law No. xx-2013
metadata.author: Office

text:
3.3 A student  selected for admission shall register to follow the Common Core  Course 
(Semesters 1 and 2) of the Degree Programme. Such registration shall  be carried out as

metadata.creator: Microsoft® Word for Microsoft 365
metadata.title: Degree of the Batchelor of the Science of Engineering By-Law No. xx-2013
metadata.author: Office

text:
prescribed by the Senate.  
 
3.4 Eligibility for registration for the subsequent Semesters of the programme shall be

metadata.creator: Microsoft® Word for Microsoft 365
metadata.title: Degree of the Batchelor of the Science of Engineering By-Law No. xx-2013
metadata.author: Office

text:
determined in accordance with the Section 4.2 and Section 7.3 of the Regulations as 
laid down by the Senate.

metadata.creator: Microsoft® Word for Microsoft 365
metadata.title: Degree of the Batchelor of the Science of Engineering By-Law No. xx-2013
metadata.author: Office

text:
laid down by the Senate.  
 
3.5 Prescribed fees payable for registration, examinations, and course fee wherever relevant

metadata.creator: Microsoft® Word for Microsoft 365
metadata.title: Degree of the Batchelor of the Science of Engineering By-Law No. xx-2013
metadata.author: Office

text:
shall be as determined by the Council of the University hereinafter referred to as “the 
Council” . 
 
3.6 A student  admitted to the Degree Programme shall not be permitted  concurrent

metadata.creator: Microsoft® Word for Microsoft 365
metadata.title: Degree of the Batchelor of the Science of Engineering By-Law No. xx-2013
metadata.author: Office

text:
registration for any other fulltime course of study , not permitted to register,  or appear 
for any external examination without the prior consent of the Senate.  
 
 
4.0 Evaluation

metadata.creator: Microsoft® Word for Microsoft 365
metadata.title: Degree of the Batchelor of the Science of Engineering By-Law No. xx-2013
metadata.author: Office

text:
4.0 Evaluation  
 
4.1 The performance of a student shall be evaluated for each course module as  prescribed 
by the Senate on the recommendation of the Faculty Board subject  to eligibility

metadata.creator: Microsoft® Word for Microsoft 365
metadata.title: Degree of the Batchelor of the Science of Engineering By-Law No. xx-2013
metadata.author: Office

text:
requirements  stipulated in the Regulations.  
 
4.2 The continuous assessment component may include marks from one or more of the

metadata.creator: Microsoft® Word for Microsoft 365
metadata.title: Degree of the Batchelor of the Science of Engineering By-Law No. xx-2013
metadata.author: Office

text:
following: class participation, marked assignments, laboratory/field reports, designs, 
work camp(s), projects, seminars, presentations , demonstrations, oral examinations ,

metadata.creator: Microsoft® Word for Microsoft 365
metadata.title: Degree of the Batchelor of the Science of Engineering By-Law No. xx-2013
metadata.author: Office

text:
and in-class assessments.  
 
4.3 The mode of assessment and the distribution of weight between continuous assessment

metadata.creator: Microsoft® Word for Microsoft 365
metadata.title: Degree of the Batchelor of the Science of Engineering By-Law No. xx-2013
metadata.author: Office

text:
and end -of-semester examination for each module shall be determined by the Senate on 
the recommendation of the Faculty Board.

metadata.creator: Microsoft® Word for Microsoft 365
metadata.title: Degree of the Batchelor of the Science of Engineering By-Law No. xx-2013
metadata.author: Office

text:
4.4 An outline of the module, class activities, assignments, examinations , and weights 
assigned shall be announced to the students by the Coordinator/Lecturer -in-charge at

metadata.creator: Microsoft® Word for Microsoft 365
metadata.title: Degree of the Batchelor of the Science of Engineering By-Law No. xx-2013
metadata.author: Office

text:
the commencement of the module.  
 
4.5 A Board of Examiners shall consider the performance of the candidate based on the

metadata.creator: Microsoft® Word for Microsoft 365
metadata.title: Degree of the Batchelor of the Science of Engineering By-Law No. xx-2013
metadata.author: Office

text:
assessment made by the examiners/moderators at the end of each semester and shall 
make recommendation to the Senate .

metadata.creator: Microsoft® Word for Microsoft 365
metadata.title: Degree of the Batchelor of the Science of Engineering By-Law No. xx-2013
metadata.author: Office

text:
4.6 A student's registration for modules of a Semester shall be considered as the registration 
for examination of modules in the Semester.

metadata.creator: Microsoft® Word for Microsoft 365
metadata.title: Degree of the Batchelor of the Science of Engineering By-Law No. xx-2013
metadata.author: Office

text: Senate No. : 389         Date: 27.03.2024        Council No. 448               Date: 08.08.2024         Effective Date: 13.03.2023

metadata.creator: Microsoft® Word for Microsoft 365
metadata.title: Degree of the Batchelor of the Science of Engineering By-Law No. xx-2013
metadata.author: Office

text:
4.7 A repeater is a student who has previously attempted a module and did not achieve a 
passing grade, and desires to retake the exam.  An application to appear for an

metadata.creator: Microsoft® Word for Microsoft 365
metadata.title: Degree of the Batchelor of the Science of Engineering By-Law No. xx-2013
metadata.author: Office

text:
examination as a repeater shall be made prior to prescribed dates and shall be 
accompanied by the prescribed examination fees.

metadata.creator: Microsoft® Word for Microsoft 365
metadata.title: Degree of the Batchelor of the Science of Engineering By-Law No. xx-2013
metadata.author: Office

text:
4.8 In the case of illness or other acceptable reason, a student may be permitted to withdraw 
from an examination as per conditions laid down by the Senate.

metadata.creator: Microsoft® Word for Microsoft 365
metadata.title: Degree of the Batchelor of the Science of Engineering By-Law No. xx-2013
metadata.author: Office

text:
5.0 Eligibility to Sit for Examinations  
 
5.1 The minimum of 80% attendance in the proper attempt  for theory classes, and

metadata.creator: Microsoft® Word for Microsoft 365
metadata.title: Degree of the Batchelor of the Science of Engineering By-Law No. xx-2013
metadata.author: Office

text:
completion of all laboratory sessions/field sessions/design sessions/work camp(s)/ 
project(s) is required for a student to be eligible to appear for the end semester

metadata.creator: Microsoft® Word for Microsoft 365
metadata.title: Degree of the Batchelor of the Science of Engineering By-Law No. xx-2013
metadata.author: Office

text:
examination(s) of the relevant course module. In case of Industri al Training, attendance 
is required as prescribed in the Industrial Training Manual.

metadata.creator: Microsoft® Word for Microsoft 365
metadata.title: Degree of the Batchelor of the Science of Engineering By-Law No. xx-2013
metadata.author: Office

text:
5.2 If a student is not eligible to sit for the end exam, he/she  may appeal to the Dean of the 
Faculty of Engineering to request eligibility. In such instances, the student must submit

metadata.creator: Microsoft® Word for Microsoft 365
metadata.title: Degree of the Batchelor of the Science of Engineering By-Law No. xx-2013
metadata.author: Office

text:
an appeal along with supporting documents. If the appeal is approved by the Faculty 
Board, the student may be granted permission to sit  for the examination.  
 
6.0 Allocation of Grades

metadata.creator: Microsoft® Word for Microsoft 365
metadata.title: Degree of the Batchelor of the Science of Engineering By-Law No. xx-2013
metadata.author: Office

text:
6.0 Allocation of Grades  
 
6.1 The evaluation of a Core module, a Technical Elective (TE) module and a General 
Elective (GE) module which is counted for Grade Point Average (GPA) shall be

metadata.creator: Microsoft® Word for Microsoft 365
metadata.title: Degree of the Batchelor of the Science of Engineering By-Law No. xx-2013
metadata.author: Office

text:
expressed by a letter grade on a 4.0 grading  scale according to given marks range  as 
described below.  
 
Marks 
Range  Grade  Grade Point  Notes  
85 - 100  A+  4.0  1 
75 - 84  A  4.0

metadata.creator: Microsoft® Word for Microsoft 365
metadata.title: Degree of the Batchelor of the Science of Engineering By-Law No. xx-2013
metadata.author: Office

metadata.creator: Microsoft® Word for Microsoft 365
metadata.title: Degree of the Batchelor of the Science of Engineering By-Law No. xx-2013
metadata.author: Office

text:
Grade  Reason  Note  
MC Academic Concession for medical reasons  6 
AC Academic Concession other reasons 
except medicals  7 
WH Results Withheld  8

metadata.creator: Microsoft® Word for Microsoft 365
metadata.title: Degree of the Batchelor of the Science of Engineering By-Law No. xx-2013
metadata.author: Office

text:
Senate No. : 389         Date: 27.03.2024        Council No. 448               Date: 08.08.2024         Effective Date: 13.03.2023  Note s: 
1. Grade A+ signifies outstanding  performance.

metadata.creator: Microsoft® Word for Microsoft 365
metadata.title: Degree of the Batchelor of the Science of Engineering By-Law No. xx-2013
metadata.author: Office

text:
2. Grade C or above is the normal requirement to pass a module.  
3. Grade C - is a conditional pass grade and is counted in the calculation of the

metadata.creator: Microsoft® Word for Microsoft 365
metadata.title: Degree of the Batchelor of the Science of Engineering By-Law No. xx-2013
metadata.author: Office

text:
Semester Grade Point Average (SGPA) , and Cumulative Grade Point Average 
(CGPA) .  In the proper attempt, students can earn credits for C - grades only if

metadata.creator: Microsoft® Word for Microsoft 365
metadata.title: Degree of the Batchelor of the Science of Engineering By-Law No. xx-2013
metadata.author: Office

text:
he/she has achieved a SGPA of 2.00 or above and has, in that semester, no more 
than three grades at the level of C - or below.  In the repeat attempts, students can

metadata.creator: Microsoft® Word for Microsoft 365
metadata.title: Degree of the Batchelor of the Science of Engineering By-Law No. xx-2013
metadata.author: Office

text:
not earn credits f or C- grades. A student may improve a grade C - to the highest 
possible grade of C by repeating the m odule. Grade C and above cannot be 
improved by repeating the module.

metadata.creator: Microsoft® Word for Microsoft 365
metadata.title: Degree of the Batchelor of the Science of Engineering By-Law No. xx-2013
metadata.author: Office

text:
4. Grade E signifies failure in the module. In order to complete the module, a 
student shall repeat the module. The grade is counted in the calculation of the

metadata.creator: Microsoft® Word for Microsoft 365
metadata.title: Degree of the Batchelor of the Science of Engineering By-Law No. xx-2013
metadata.author: Office

text:
Semester Grade Point Average (SGPA)  and Cumulative Grade Point Average 
(CGPA).  
5. The Continuous Assessment marks shall be carried forward up to maximum of

metadata.creator: Microsoft® Word for Microsoft 365
metadata.title: Degree of the Batchelor of the Science of Engineering By-Law No. xx-2013
metadata.author: Office

text:
two consecutive years and shall only be replaced with an improvement by 
reattempting. Improved Continuous Assessment marks shall be eligible for the

metadata.creator: Microsoft® Word for Microsoft 365
metadata.title: Degree of the Batchelor of the Science of Engineering By-Law No. xx-2013
metadata.author: Office

text:
improvement of overall grade to h ighest possible grade of C.  
6. Grade MC signifies Academic Concession for medical reasons which enables

metadata.creator: Microsoft® Word for Microsoft 365
metadata.title: Degree of the Batchelor of the Science of Engineering By-Law No. xx-2013
metadata.author: Office

text:
the student to repeat the module as the first attempt. In such case, SGPA will not 
be calculated.  
7. Grade AC signifies Academic Concession other reasons except medicals

metadata.creator: Microsoft® Word for Microsoft 365
metadata.title: Degree of the Batchelor of the Science of Engineering By-Law No. xx-2013
metadata.author: Office

text:
considered under Note 6 which enables the student to repeat the module as the 
first attempt. In such case, SGPA will not be calculated .

metadata.creator: Microsoft® Word for Microsoft 365
metadata.title: Degree of the Batchelor of the Science of Engineering By-Law No. xx-2013
metadata.author: Office

text:
8. Grade WH signifies Results Withheld. In such a case, SGPA will not be 
calculated.  
 
6.2 General Elective (GE) modules may or may not be counted towards GPA. Those GE

metadata.creator: Microsoft® Word for Microsoft 365
metadata.title: Degree of the Batchelor of the Science of Engineering By-Law No. xx-2013
metadata.author: Office

text:
modules that are not evaluated based on the Four Point Grading System as in section 
6.1, and Industrial Training are not counted towards GPA. Upon successful completion

metadata.creator: Microsoft® Word for Microsoft 365
metadata.title: Degree of the Batchelor of the Science of Engineering By-Law No. xx-2013
metadata.author: Office

text:
of each of these modules, a grade ‘H’ indicating an Excellent Achievement, a grade 
‘M’ indicating a Good Achievement, or a grade ‘S’ indicating a Satisfactory

metadata.creator: Microsoft® Word for Microsoft 365
metadata.title: Degree of the Batchelor of the Science of Engineering By-Law No. xx-2013
metadata.author: Office

text:
Achievement is awarded according to the given marks range as shown bel ow. A student 
who receives a fail grade ‘F’ may improve it to a grade ‘S’ by repeating the module.

metadata.creator: Microsoft® Word for Microsoft 365
metadata.title: Degree of the Batchelor of the Science of Engineering By-Law No. xx-2013
metadata.author: Office

text:
The grades MC, AC  or W H may also be assigned to these modules.  
Marks Range  Grade  Description  
75 - 100 H Excellent  
60 - 74 M Good  
45 - 59 S Satisfactory  
0 - 44 F Fail

metadata.creator: Microsoft® Word for Microsoft 365
metadata.title: Degree of the Batchelor of the Science of Engineering By-Law No. xx-2013
metadata.author: Office

text:
0 - 44 F Fail 
 
6.3 A student who has missed any continuous assessment component due to illness or other 
acceptable reasons may appeal, providing supporting documents, to the module

metadata.creator: Microsoft® Word for Microsoft 365
metadata.title: Degree of the Batchelor of the Science of Engineering By-Law No. xx-2013
metadata.author: Office

text:
coordinator within one week from the date of the assessment. Documents supporting 
his/her claim should be submitted as stated in the approved Regulations under this by -
law.

metadata.creator: Microsoft® Word for Microsoft 365
metadata.title: Degree of the Batchelor of the Science of Engineering By-Law No. xx-2013
metadata.author: Office

text: Senate No. : 389         Date: 27.03.2024        Council No. 448               Date: 08.08.2024         Effective Date: 13.03.2023  6.4 A student who has missed an end -of-semester examination because

metadata.creator: Microsoft® Word for Microsoft 365
metadata.title: Degree of the Batchelor of the Science of Engineering By-Law No. xx-2013
metadata.author: Office

text: examination because of illness or other

metadata.creator: Microsoft® Word for Microsoft 365
metadata.title: Degree of the Batchelor of the Science of Engineering By-Law No. xx-2013
metadata.author: Office

text:
acceptable reason may appeal with supporting documents to the Dean for an Academic 
Concession within one week from the date of reporting to the faculty  after medical

metadata.creator: Microsoft® Word for Microsoft 365
metadata.title: Degree of the Batchelor of the Science of Engineering By-Law No. xx-2013
metadata.author: Office

text:
leave . An Academic Concession (grade MC or AC) shall require the approval of the 
Faculty Board. Documents supporting his/her claim for an Academic Concession

metadata.creator: Microsoft® Word for Microsoft 365
metadata.title: Degree of the Batchelor of the Science of Engineering By-Law No. xx-2013
metadata.author: Office

text:
should be  submitted as stated in the approved Regulations under this By -law. 
 
6.5 The highest grade obtainable at a repeat attempt is the grade C (or the grade S as the

metadata.creator: Microsoft® Word for Microsoft 365
metadata.title: Degree of the Batchelor of the Science of Engineering By-Law No. xx-2013
metadata.author: Office

text:
case may be) except when an Academic Concession has been granted.  Every grade shall 
be entered on the student's permanent record. The grade at  the first attempt and the

metadata.creator: Microsoft® Word for Microsoft 365
metadata.title: Degree of the Batchelor of the Science of Engineering By-Law No. xx-2013
metadata.author: Office

text:
improved grade earned at a subsequent attempt, if  any, shall be recorded alongside the 
number of attempts for each module.

metadata.creator: Microsoft® Word for Microsoft 365
metadata.title: Degree of the Batchelor of the Science of Engineering By-Law No. xx-2013
metadata.author: Office

text:
6.6 The Grade Point Average (GPA ) is calculated  at the end of the student’s study 
programme in the faculty , by considering all the core modules, Technical Elective (TE)

metadata.creator: Microsoft® Word for Microsoft 365
metadata.title: Degree of the Batchelor of the Science of Engineering By-Law No. xx-2013
metadata.author: Office

text:
modules and General Elective (GE) modules which are counted for GPA , as follows.  If 
the number of Technical Elective and General Elective (counted for GPA) modules

metadata.creator: Microsoft® Word for Microsoft 365
metadata.title: Degree of the Batchelor of the Science of Engineering By-Law No. xx-2013
metadata.author: Office

text:
completed by a student exceeds the requisite number, the excessive number of modules 
is selected and removed in GPA calculation to maximize the GPA.  
 
𝐺𝑃𝐴 = ∑ 𝑤𝑖 𝐶𝑖 𝐺𝑃𝑉 𝑖 𝑛
𝑖=1
∑ 𝑤𝑖 𝐶𝑖𝑛
𝑖=1

metadata.creator: Microsoft® Word for Microsoft 365
metadata.title: Degree of the Batchelor of the Science of Engineering By-Law No. xx-2013
metadata.author: Office

text:
𝑖=1
∑ 𝑤𝑖 𝐶𝑖𝑛
𝑖=1 
where 
𝑤𝑖={0.05 for 𝑖𝑡ℎmodule  in semesters  1,2                
0.15 𝑖𝑡ℎmodule  in for semesters  3,4,5,6,7,8

metadata.creator: Microsoft® Word for Microsoft 365
metadata.title: Degree of the Batchelor of the Science of Engineering By-Law No. xx-2013
metadata.author: Office

text:
n is the number of modules with an earned GPA up to the time of calculation  
𝐶𝑖 is the number of credits allocated to ith module,  
𝐺𝑃𝑉 𝑖 is the Grade Point Value earned for the 𝑖th module.

metadata.creator: Microsoft® Word for Microsoft 365
metadata.title: Degree of the Batchelor of the Science of Engineering By-Law No. xx-2013
metadata.author: Office

text:
The semester G rade Point Average  (SGPA)  of the jth semester, calculated as  
 
SGPA j=∑ 𝐶𝑖  GPV i n
i=1
∑ 𝐶𝑖n
𝑖=1 
 
𝑛 is the number of registered  modules counted for GPA in the jth semester

metadata.creator: Microsoft® Word for Microsoft 365
metadata.title: Degree of the Batchelor of the Science of Engineering By-Law No. xx-2013
metadata.author: Office

text:
𝐶𝑖 is the number of credits allocated to 𝑖th module of 𝑗th semester  
GPV i is the Grade Point Value earned for the 𝑖th module of 𝑗th semester

metadata.creator: Microsoft® Word for Microsoft 365
metadata.title: Degree of the Batchelor of the Science of Engineering By-Law No. xx-2013
metadata.author: Office

text:
The Cumulative Grade Point Average (CGPA) is calculated  based on the summation of 
Grade Point Values earned for all modules registered for credits, up to the time of

metadata.creator: Microsoft® Word for Microsoft 365
metadata.title: Degree of the Batchelor of the Science of Engineering By-Law No. xx-2013
metadata.author: Office

text:
calculation, weighted according to the number of credits and module weight as follows.  
CGPA = ∑ 𝑤𝑖𝐶𝑖 GPV 𝑖 𝑛
𝑖=1
∑ 𝑤𝑖𝐶𝑖𝑛
𝑖=1  
where

metadata.creator: Microsoft® Word for Microsoft 365
metadata.title: Degree of the Batchelor of the Science of Engineering By-Law No. xx-2013
metadata.author: Office

text:
𝑖=1
∑ 𝑤𝑖𝐶𝑖𝑛
𝑖=1  
where  
n is the number of modules with an earned GPA up to the time of calculation,  
𝐶𝑖 is the number of credits allocated to ith module,

metadata.creator: Microsoft® Word for Microsoft 365
metadata.title: Degree of the Batchelor of the Science of Engineering By-Law No. xx-2013
metadata.author: Office

text: Senate No. : 389         Date: 27.03.2024        Council No. 448               Date: 08.08.2024         Effective Date: 13.03.2023  𝑤𝑖={0.05 weight  for 𝑖𝑡ℎ module   in  semesters  1,2

metadata.creator: Microsoft® Word for Microsoft 365
metadata.title: Degree of the Batchelor of the Science of Engineering By-Law No. xx-2013
metadata.author: Office

text:
0.15 weight  for 𝑖𝑡ℎ module   in semesters  3,4,5,6,7,8 
GPV i is the Grade Point value earned for the 𝑖th module.

metadata.creator: Microsoft® Word for Microsoft 365
metadata.title: Degree of the Batchelor of the Science of Engineering By-Law No. xx-2013
metadata.author: Office

text:
GPA , SGPA , and CGPA  shall be calculated up to the nearest second decimal . point.  
 
 
7.0 Requirement for Graduation

metadata.creator: Microsoft® Word for Microsoft 365
metadata.title: Degree of the Batchelor of the Science of Engineering By-Law No. xx-2013
metadata.author: Office

text:
A candidate  to be admitted to the degree of the Bachelor of the Science of  Engineering  
Honours (BScEngHons ) shall satisfy the following requirements:

metadata.creator: Microsoft® Word for Microsoft 365
metadata.title: Degree of the Batchelor of the Science of Engineering By-Law No. xx-2013
metadata.author: Office

text:
a) A minimum total of 150 credits that comprise of all the Core modules,  Technical 
Elective (TE) modules, General Elective (GE) modules and  Industrial Training,

metadata.creator: Microsoft® Word for Microsoft 365
metadata.title: Degree of the Batchelor of the Science of Engineering By-Law No. xx-2013
metadata.author: Office

text:
satisfying the conditions in Sections 6.1 and 6.2 as relevant.  
b) Technical Elective (TE) modules and General Elective (GE) modules must be  chosen

metadata.creator: Microsoft® Word for Microsoft 365
metadata.title: Degree of the Batchelor of the Science of Engineering By-Law No. xx-2013
metadata.author: Office

text:
from the list offered by the relevant Department satisfying the  accreditation 
requirements for an engineering degree as specified by the  Institution of Engineers Sri 
Lanka (IESL).

metadata.creator: Microsoft® Word for Microsoft 365
metadata.title: Degree of the Batchelor of the Science of Engineering By-Law No. xx-2013
metadata.author: Office

text:
Lanka (IESL).  
c) Completion of the Developmental Programme , Industrial Training , English  Language 
Proficiency Test,  and any other mandatory  requirements prescribed by the Faculty

metadata.creator: Microsoft® Word for Microsoft 365
metadata.title: Degree of the Batchelor of the Science of Engineering By-Law No. xx-2013
metadata.author: Office

text:
Board with the approval of the Senate.  
d) A residence requirement of four academic years as a duly registered full-time student 
of the University.

metadata.creator: Microsoft® Word for Microsoft 365
metadata.title: Degree of the Batchelor of the Science of Engineering By-Law No. xx-2013
metadata.author: Office

text:
of the University.  
e) A minimum Grade Point Average (GPA) of 2.00  at the time of eligible for graduation . 
 
 
8.0 Award of Classes

metadata.creator: Microsoft® Word for Microsoft 365
metadata.title: Degree of the Batchelor of the Science of Engineering By-Law No. xx-2013
metadata.author: Office

text:
8.0 Award of Classes  
 
8.1 A student shall be deemed to be eligible for the award of the degree of BScEngHons

metadata.creator: Microsoft® Word for Microsoft 365
metadata.title: Degree of the Batchelor of the Science of Engineering By-Law No. xx-2013
metadata.author: Office

text:
with a class  on satisfying the Grade Point Average (GPA) not  less than 3.00 and 
completion of all programme requirements to the  satisfaction of the Senate within a

metadata.creator: Microsoft® Word for Microsoft 365
metadata.title: Degree of the Batchelor of the Science of Engineering By-Law No. xx-2013
metadata.author: Office

text:
period of four academic years from the date  of commencement of the programme of 
study.  
 
8.2 The award of BScEngHons with a class shall be according to the Grade Point Average

metadata.creator: Microsoft® Word for Microsoft 365
metadata.title: Degree of the Batchelor of the Science of Engineering By-Law No. xx-2013
metadata.author: Office

text:
values stipulated below;  
  
GPA  Class Awarded  
GPA ≥ 3.70 First Class  
3.30 ≤ GPA < 3.70  Second Class Upper Division  
3.00 ≤ GPA < 3.30  Second Class Lower Division

metadata.creator: Microsoft® Word for Microsoft 365
metadata.title: Degree of the Batchelor of the Science of Engineering By-Law No. xx-2013
metadata.author: Office

text:
8.3 A candidate who has not satisfied the eligibility requirements for a class stated under 
section  8.1 shall be deemed to be eligible for the award of the  degree of BScEngHons

metadata.creator: Microsoft® Word for Microsoft 365
metadata.title: Degree of the Batchelor of the Science of Engineering By-Law No. xx-2013
metadata.author: Office

text:
on satisfying the minimum graduation requirements  stated under 7(a) to 7(e). 
 
8.4 A candidate  who satisfies the GPA requirement for  a Class  but takes  longer than four

metadata.creator: Microsoft® Word for Microsoft 365
metadata.title: Degree of the Batchelor of the Science of Engineering By-Law No. xx-2013
metadata.author: Office

text: academic years to complete the programme requirements  may be deemed to be eligible

metadata.creator: Microsoft® Word for Microsoft 365
metadata.title: Degree of the Batchelor of the Science of Engineering By-Law No. xx-2013
metadata.author: Office

text: Senate No. : 389         Date: 27.03.2024        Council No. 448               Date: 08.08.2024         Effective Date: 13.03.2023  for the award of a BScEngHons  degree with  a Class  as decided by

metadata.creator: Microsoft® Word for Microsoft 365
metadata.title: Degree of the Batchelor of the Science of Engineering By-Law No. xx-2013
metadata.author: Office

text: with  a Class  as decided by the Senate on the

metadata.creator: Microsoft® Word for Microsoft 365
metadata.title: Degree of the Batchelor of the Science of Engineering By-Law No. xx-2013
metadata.author: Office

text:
recommendation of the Faculty  Board under extenuating circumstances.  
 
8.5 Notwithstanding the above provisions, individual cases may be dealt with on  the basis

metadata.creator: Microsoft® Word for Microsoft 365
metadata.title: Degree of the Batchelor of the Science of Engineering By-Law No. xx-2013
metadata.author: Office

text:
of their own merits by the Faculty Board with the approval of the  Senate on the 
recommendation of the Board of Examiners.  
 
 
9.0 Award of the Degree

metadata.creator: Microsoft® Word for Microsoft 365
metadata.title: Degree of the Batchelor of the Science of Engineering By-Law No. xx-2013
metadata.author: Office

text:
9.0 Award of the Degree  
 
A student shall be eligible for the conferment of the degree in Bachelor of the Science of

metadata.creator: Microsoft® Word for Microsoft 365
metadata.title: Degree of the Batchelor of the Science of Engineering By-Law No. xx-2013
metadata.author: Office

text:
Engineering Honours after the successful completion of all the stipulated requirements in 
section 7 within a maximum period of eight academic years from the date of the first

metadata.creator: Microsoft® Word for Microsoft 365
metadata.title: Degree of the Batchelor of the Science of Engineering By-Law No. xx-2013
metadata.author: Office

text:
registration to the faculty . 
 
 
10.0 Effective  Date of the Degree  
 
10.1 The effective date of the degree shall be the date following the last day of the final

metadata.creator: Microsoft® Word for Microsoft 365
metadata.title: Degree of the Batchelor of the Science of Engineering By-Law No. xx-2013
metadata.author: Office

text:
evaluation conducted by the faculty  when the student fulfils all the requirements for 
graduation.  
10.2 In case a student has an ongoing inquiry for an examination or disciplinary offenses

metadata.creator: Microsoft® Word for Microsoft 365
metadata.title: Degree of the Batchelor of the Science of Engineering By-Law No. xx-2013
metadata.author: Office

text:
conducted against him/her by the University, results of the relevant examination/s 
shall not be released until the inquiry is completed. In such situations, the effective

metadata.creator: Microsoft® Word for Microsoft 365
metadata.title: Degree of the Batchelor of the Science of Engineering By-Law No. xx-2013
metadata.author: Office

text:
date of the degree shall be determined by the Senate.  
 
 
11.0 Revision of By -law/ Regulations  
 
11.1 Regulations under this By -law may be revised/amended by the Senate as and when

metadata.creator: Microsoft® Word for Microsoft 365
metadata.title: Degree of the Batchelor of the Science of Engineering By-Law No. xx-2013
metadata.author: Office

text:
necessary . 
 
11.2 All other common Rules and Regulations applicable to Universities in Sri Lanka and 
to the University of Ruhuna in particular are also applicable to students registered for

metadata.creator: Microsoft® Word for Microsoft 365
metadata.title: Degree of the Batchelor of the Science of Engineering By-Law No. xx-2013
metadata.author: Office

text:
this degree programme.  
 
11.3 This By -law may be revised/amended as and when necessary.  
 
 
12.0 Interpretations  
 
12.1 In this By -law unless the context otherwise requires:

metadata.creator: Microsoft® Word for Microsoft 365
metadata.title: Degree of the Batchelor of the Science of Engineering By-Law No. xx-2013
metadata.author: Office

text:
"University" means the "University of Ruhuna, Sri Lanka" as established by  the 
Gazette Notification No. 281/07 dated 24 -01-1984.

metadata.creator: Microsoft® Word for Microsoft 365
metadata.title: Degree of the Batchelor of the Science of Engineering By-Law No. xx-2013
metadata.author: Office

text:
"Council" means "the Council of the University of Ruhuna", constituted by the  
Universities Act No.16 of 1978 and amendments thereof.

metadata.creator: Microsoft® Word for Microsoft 365
metadata.title: Degree of the Batchelor of the Science of Engineering By-Law No. xx-2013
metadata.author: Office

text: Senate No. : 389         Date: 27.03.2024        Council No. 448               Date: 08.08.2024         Effective Date: 13.03.2023  "Senate" means "the Senate of the University of Ruhuna", constituted

metadata.creator: Microsoft® Word for Microsoft 365
metadata.title: Degree of the Batchelor of the Science of Engineering By-Law No. xx-2013
metadata.author: Office

text: of Ruhuna", constituted by the

metadata.creator: Microsoft® Word for Microsoft 365
metadata.title: Degree of the Batchelor of the Science of Engineering By-Law No. xx-2013
metadata.author: Office

text:
Universities Act No. 16 of 1978 and amendments thereof.  
"Faculty of Engineering" or "Faculty" means "the Faculty of Engineering,  University 
of Ruhuna".

metadata.creator: Microsoft® Word for Microsoft 365
metadata.title: Degree of the Batchelor of the Science of Engineering By-Law No. xx-2013
metadata.author: Office

text:
of Ruhuna".  
"Faculty Board" means "the Faculty Board of the Faculty of Engineering , University 
of Ruhuna".  
"Dean" means "the Dean of the Faculty of Engineering, University of  Ruhuna".

metadata.creator: Microsoft® Word for Microsoft 365
metadata.title: Degree of the Batchelor of the Science of Engineering By-Law No. xx-2013
metadata.author: Office

text:
"Head of the Department" means "the Head of the Department of Study"  where the 
student is enrolled.  
 
12.2 Any question regarding the interpretation of this By -law shall be referred to  the

metadata.creator: Microsoft® Word for Microsoft 365
metadata.title: Degree of the Batchelor of the Science of Engineering By-Law No. xx-2013
metadata.author: Office

text: Council whose decision thereon shall be final and conclusive.

metadata.creator: Microsoft® Word for Microsoft 365
metadata.title: Degree of the Batchelor of the Science of Engineering By-Law No. xx-2013
metadata.author: Office
